critique: This document is an approval of a Code of Fair Competition for the Hair Cloth Manufacturing Industry under the National Industrial Recovery Act of 1933. This act was part of Franklin D. Roosevelt's New Deal program. The document itself doesn't directly address immigration, executive power, federalism, national security, or social inclusion. However, it does heavily involve the government in economic regulation. Given that this is a New Deal policy, it leans liberal in its ideological tilt.
